description: Gave a talk at the University of Washington to the [CS Quantum](https://quantum.cs.washington.edu/) on the sample complexity of quantum error mitigation.

I'm on Bluesky! After not being on social media for years, this is a bit of an experiment. Trying to engage with quantum folks. Give me internet points: [@loglog.wtf](https://bsky.app/profile/loglog.wtf).

Visited [QuSoft](https://qusoft.org/) Wed-Fri! Gave a talk: _Quantum Error Mitigation; from theory to practice_ [[slides](https://natestemen.github.io/qem-qusoft/)], and got to talk to some amazing researchers. Thanks to [John van de Wetering](https://vdwetering.name/) for the invite.

I Co-organized the quantum computing devroom at FOSDEM alongside [Alessandro](https://cosenal.github.io/) and [Purva](https://github.com/purva-thakre). Our write up is available on the [UF blog](https://unitary.foundation/posts/2025_fosdem_recap/)!

Preached about random number generators, and how quantum computers can be used to generate true random numbers to anyone who would listen at the [Georgetown Steam Plant Science Fair](https://www.georgetownsteamplant.org/2024). [[insta](https://www.instagram.com/georgetownsciencefair/p/DGCFgQAyq8s/)]
Co-organized a series of talks on Mitiq at the [QNumerics summer school](https://qnumerics.org/2024/) with the UF team.
